titles: Eugenius Theodidactus. The prophetical trumpeter sounding an allarum to England illustrating the fate of Great Britain, past, present, and to come. Such wonderful things to happen these seven yeers following, as have not been heard of heretofore. A celestial vision. VVith a description of heaven and heavenly things, motives to pacifie Gods threatned wrath: of a bloody, fiery way of the day of judgment, and of saints and angels. / Sung in a most heavenly hymn, to the great comfort of all good Christians, by the Muses most unworthy, John Heydon, gent. philomat.
author: Heydon, John, b. 1629.
publisher: Printed by T. Lock for the author, and are to be sold by Thomas Blackmore, at the angel in Pauls Church-yard,
notes: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
